title: Path Traversal on Resolve-Path
content:
The author of resolve-path told me that I can submit this to here. The vulnerability already reported to the author and got a fixed!
Module
module name: resolve-path
version: 1.3.3
npm page: https://www.npmjs.com/package/resolve-path
Description
Resolve a relative path against a root path with validation.
This module would protect against commons attacks like GET /../file.js which reaches outside the root folder.

Description
The library failed to process path like C:../../ on Windows
Steps To Reproduce:
Code 55 Bytes
1require('resolve-path')("C:/windows/temp/", "C:../../")
Supporting Material/References:
Windows 10
Node v8.9.4
NPM 5.6.0
Wrap up
[Y] I contacted the maintainer to let him know
[N] I opened an issue in the related repository
Impact
This is a high-dependency library, for example: KoaJS is suffered from this vulnerability

steps: Install the vulnerable version of resolve-path (1.3.3) in a Windows environment.
vuln_description: The resolve-path library fails to properly validate and resolve paths on Windows when given input like 'C:../../', allowing path traversal outside the intended root directory.
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward path manipulation technique specific to Windows path handling. While it requires knowledge of Windows path conventions, the attack vector is simple and doesn't involve multiple components or complex interactions.
